page.title: 07GRAVEL EXTRACTION: UPMINSTER
page.content: {Gravel extraction}in Havering is concentrated in the south of the Borough due to a belt of rich,fluvial deposits laid down by the retreating River Thames.The main Gravel workings are in an{agricultural}area south of Upminster and east of Rainham and typical locations are Gerpins Farm,Sullens Farm and Bush Farm.The rich alluvial deposits have also resulted in high grade agricultural soil and many{conflicts}arise from the use of this for{Gravel extraction. { Pollution}from noise and heavy vehicles, and visual impact affects the environment greatly,though some landscaping does take place. However, when extraction has finished, the pits are put to a variety of uses,such as agriculture,recreation and refuse tipping which takes place at{Gerpins {Lane. }
